intro: Besleria hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy besleria, is a herbaceous perennial native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in humid, warm environments with indirect light. Its leaves are broad and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are upright and branching. This species is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
